title: Psalms Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of Psalms with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 150 chapters.

questions.question: Who is described as 'like a tree planted by the rivers of water' in Psalms chapter 1?
options: The man that delighteth in the law of the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: The man that delighteth in the law of the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalm 1:3 describes a man who delights in God's law as being like a well-watered tree that prospers.

questions.question: According to Psalms 3:3, who is a shield about David?
questions.explanation: Psalms 3:3 states that the LORD is a shield around David, providing protection.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 23 declares that 'the LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want.'
questions.explanation: Psalm 23:1 begins with this well-known declaration of trust in God as shepherd.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Thy word is a lamp unto my ______, and a light unto my path.'
questions.explanation: Psalm 119:105 uses this metaphor to describe the guidance given by God's word.

questions.question: What is the main theme of Psalms 51?
questions.explanation: Psalm 51 is a heartfelt confession of sin and plea for God's mercy, traditionally attributed to David after his sin with Bathsheba.

questions.question: In Psalms 46:1, how is God described?
options: A mighty fortress and help in trouble
questions.correctAnswer: A mighty fortress and help in trouble
questions.explanation: Psalm 46:1 calls God a very present help and refuge, a mighty fortress.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 119 is the longest chapter in the Bible.
questions.explanation: Psalm 119 contains 176 verses and is the longest chapter in the entire Bible.

questions.question: Who is the author of many of the Psalms, including Psalms 3 and 38?
questions.explanation: David is traditionally credited as the author of many Psalms, including Psalms 3 and 38.

questions.question: In Psalms 150, what are believers encouraged to use to praise the LORD?
questions.explanation: Psalm 150 lists various instruments and dancing as means to praise God.

questions.question: True or False: Psalms 37 teaches that the wicked will ultimately prosper forever.
questions.explanation: Psalm 37 contrasts the temporary prosperity of the wicked with the lasting blessings of the righteous.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Psalms 27:1: 'The LORD is my light and my ______; whom shall I fear?'
questions.explanation: Psalm 27:1 emphasizes the LORD as the psalmist's light and salvation, providing courage.

questions.question: What does Psalm 91:1 describe as a place of safety?
options: The secret place of the Most High
questions.correctAnswer: The secret place of the Most High
questions.explanation: Psalm 91:1 speaks of abiding in the secret place of the Most High for protection.

questions.question: Who is called blessed in Psalms 112:1?
options: The man that feareth the LORD and delighteth in His commandments
questions.correctAnswer: The man that feareth the LORD and delighteth in His commandments
questions.explanation: Psalm 112:1 highlights the blessings on those who fear God and love His law.

questions.question: True or False: Psalm 150 ends with the command, 'Let everything that hath breath praise the LORD.'
questions.explanation: Psalm 150:6 calls all living beings to praise God.

questions.question: In Psalms 139:7, where does the psalmist say he can flee from the Spirit of the LORD?
options: To the ends of the earth
To the depths of the sea
questions.explanation: Psalm 139:7 asks rhetorically if one can flee from God's Spirit anywhere, implying it is impossible.

questions.question: What is the 'cup' referred to in Psalms 75:8?
options: A cup of blessing for the righteous
A cup of wrath poured out by the LORD
A cup of wine for celebration
questions.correctAnswer: A cup of wrath poured out by the LORD
questions.explanation: Psalm 75:8 speaks of the LORD having a cup full of mixture that the wicked must drink.

questions.question: True or False: Psalm 22 begins with the words 'My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?'
questions.explanation: Psalm 22:1 opens with this famous lament.

questions.question: According to Psalms 34:8, what should one do to taste and see that the LORD is good?
questions.explanation: Psalm 34:8 invites the reader to fear God and experience His goodness.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'The LORD is my ______; I shall not want.'
questions.explanation: Psalm 23:1 identifies the LORD as the psalmist's shepherd.

questions.question: In Psalms 121:1-2, from where does the psalmist say help comes?
options: From the LORD, which made heaven and earth
questions.correctAnswer: From the LORD, which made heaven and earth
questions.explanation: Psalm 121:1-2 emphasizes that help comes from God, maker of heaven and earth.

questions.question: True or False: Psalm 19 declares that the heavens declare the glory of God.
questions.explanation: Psalm 19:1 states that the heavens show the work of God's hands.

questions.question: What does Psalm 46:10 command us to do?
options: Be still and know that I am God
questions.correctAnswer: Be still and know that I am God
questions.explanation: Psalm 46:10 instructs believers to cease striving and recognize God's sovereignty.

questions.question: Who is described as 'a man that feareth the LORD' who will have a 'generation of the upright' blessed in Psalm 112?
questions.explanation: Psalm 112:1-2 speaks of the blessings on the righteous who fear God.

questions.question: True or False: In Psalms 91, God promises angels will keep believers in all their ways.
questions.explanation: Psalm 91:11-12 describes God's angels guarding believers.

questions.question: According to Psalms 19:7, what is perfect, converting the soul?
questions.explanation: Psalm 19:7 praises the law of the LORD for its perfection and life-giving power.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Psalms 37:4: 'Delight thyself also in the LORD; and he shall give thee the desires of thy ______.'
questions.explanation: Psalm 37:4 promises that God will fulfill the desires of those who delight in Him.

questions.question: What is the main message of Psalms 46?
options: God's protection and refuge in trouble
questions.correctAnswer: God's protection and refuge in trouble
questions.explanation: Psalm 46 emphasizes God's presence as a refuge and strength in times of trouble.

questions.question: True or False: Psalm 137 laments the captivity of Israel by the rivers of Babylon.
questions.explanation: Psalm 137 expresses sorrow and longing for Jerusalem during exile in Babylon.

questions.question: Who is said to be 'full of compassion, and righteous' in Psalms 112:4?
questions.explanation: Psalm 112:4 describes the upright as gracious, compassionate, and righteous.

questions.question: According to Psalms 34:18, who is close to the brokenhearted?
questions.explanation: Psalm 34:18 assures that God is near those who are brokenhearted and contrite.

questions.question: True or False: Psalm 8 praises God for His creation and man's honored place within it.
questions.explanation: Psalm 8 marvels at God's creation and how He made man a little lower than angels.

questions.question: In Psalms 119:11, what has the psalmist hidden in his heart to avoid sinning against God?
questions.explanation: Psalm 119:11 says, 'Thy word have I hid in mine heart, that I might not sin against thee.'

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'The LORD is my strength and my ______; he also is my salvation.'
questions.explanation: Psalm 118:14 declares the LORD as the psalmist's strength and song.

questions.question: According to Psalms 40:1, what did the psalmist do while waiting patiently for the LORD?
questions.explanation: Psalm 40:1 recounts patiently waiting and then calling upon the LORD.

questions.question: True or False: Psalm 91 promises that no evil shall befall those who trust in God.
questions.explanation: Psalm 91:10 states that no evil shall befall the one who dwells in God's shelter.

questions.question: In Psalms 9:9, who is described as a refuge for the oppressed?
questions.explanation: Psalm 9:9 declares that the LORD is a refuge for the oppressed in times of trouble.

questions.question: Who is the 'rock' and 'salvation' mentioned in Psalms 62:2?
questions.explanation: Psalm 62:2 calls the LORD the rock and salvation of the psalmist.

questions.question: True or False: Psalm 34 declares that those who seek the LORD shall not lack any good thing.
questions.explanation: Psalm 34:10 assures that those who fear the LORD will have their needs met.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Blessed is the man that maketh the LORD his ______.'
questions.explanation: Psalm 40:4 speaks of the man who makes the LORD his refuge as being blessed.

questions.question: According to Psalms 73:26, what is the LORD to the psalmist's heart and portion?
questions.explanation: Psalm 73:26 says God is the strength and portion of the psalmist forever.

questions.question: What does Psalm 121:7-8 say about the LORD's protection?
options: He watches over our going out and coming in
questions.correctAnswer: He watches over our going out and coming in
questions.explanation: Psalm 121:7-8 assures that God watches over all the ways of His people.

questions.question: True or False: Psalm 1 contrasts the way of the righteous with the way of the ungodly.
questions.explanation: Psalm 1 contrasts the blessings of the righteous with the fate of the ungodly.

questions.question: According to Psalms 34:17, what does the LORD do for the righteous and those that are crushed in spirit?
options: He delivers them from all their troubles
questions.correctAnswer: He delivers them from all their troubles
questions.explanation: Psalm 34:17 promises God's deliverance for the righteous and brokenhearted.

questions.question: Who is said to be 'a light in the darkness' in Psalm 112:4?
questions.explanation: Psalm 112:4 states that light arises in darkness for the upright.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Psalms 40:2: 'He brought me up also out of an horrible pit, out of the miry ______.'
questions.explanation: Psalm 40:2 describes God's deliverance out of a miry pit.
